ca.krasnay.sqlbuilder.orm
Class Mapping<T>

java.lang.Object
  ca.krasnay.sqlbuilder.orm.Mapping<T>

public class Mapping<T>
extends Object

A mapping maps a Java class to a database table and the fields in the class to columns in the table. Typically, you would create a DAO that creates and holds the mapping for a particular entity class. DAO methods would delegate to the equivalent mapping methods. Each mapping must be provided with an OrmConfig object representing the ORM environment, including which data source and IdSource to use. There are a number of features of a full-fledged ORM tool such Hibernate that this class doesn't try to do:

  • Manage associations.
  • Map a class hierarchy between one or more tables.
  • Map a field across multiple columns, or vice versa.
  • Implement object caching.
  • Automated DDL (creating tables and columns where necessary).
We believe that these features are the cause of most of the complexity and therefore confusion that arises from tools such as Hibernate.

public Mapping<T> addFields()
Adds mappings for each declared field in the mapped class. Any fields already mapped by addColumn are skipped.

isPersistent

public boolean isPersistent(T entity)
Returns true if this entity has already been inserted into the database. By default, returns true if the primary key is not null, and for numeric fields, is non-zero.
